derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Scottish Gaelic carn.

entry.tran: (标志边界、崎岖路径、山顶或纪念某人的)石堆，石标
entry.def: A cairn is a pile of stones which marks a boundary, a route across rough ground, or the top of a mountain. A cairn is sometimes also built in memory of someone.

means.word_mean: 1. a mound of stones piled up as a memorial or to mark a boundary or path
2. small rough-haired breed of terrier from Scotland
